key_risks: Economic sensitivity due to cyclical demand tied to construction and industrial sectors
Supply chain disruptions affecting equipment availability and costs
Environmental scrutiny over emissions from diesel-powered fleet
Legal and financial liabilities from ongoing litigation and past SEC complaints
Labor shortages and safety compliance risks
controversies: 2008 SEC complaint alleging fraudulent transactions to meet earnings forecasts
Ongoing litigation, including Wallen v. United Rentals settlement and disputes with Cerberus Capital Management
environmental_issues: Emissions from diesel-powered fleet despite investments in low- and zero-emission equipment
social_issues: Labor shortages and workplace safety concerns
governance_issues: Legal challenges and financial liabilities from past and ongoing litigation

sources.title: SEC v. United Rentals, LLC, et al. Case No. 08-cv-01354-CFD (D. Conn.)
